result.execSummary:
All charges against Michael Timothy Shelton Jr in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Timothy Shelton Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Timothy Shelton Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Timothy Shelton Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Michael Timothy Shelton Jr. Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared in court on behalf of Attorney Patrick T. Franken for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Court reviewed State's Motion to Dismiss. Discussion placed on the record. For reasons stated on the record, State moves to dismiss case without prejudice. Defense does not object. Court orders case DISMISSED without prejudice. Defendant released from all conditions of bail. Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the person who posted bail.
-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (14 pages) commencing 07-15-22 by SANDRA KANDZIORA.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsven.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Feiss, Br. 46.

Defendant Michael Timothy Shelton in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael Timothy Shelton in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Patrick. Court took judicial notice of 03CF1756. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court received and reviewed Defendant's Motion to Dismiss filed 06/14/2022. Because the defendant is now represented by counsel, the Court does not take action on the motion filed by the defendant, not filed by his attorney.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Michael Timothy Shelton not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant was not produced by zoom from Oshkosh. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Case w/Prejudice.  (Michael T. Shelton, Jr. - #453917, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, PO Box 3310, Oshkosh WI 54903-3310).

Attorney Thomas R. Reed in court, defendant Michael Timothy Shelton not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a hearing. Discussion held on the record with defense regarding lack of appointment of counsel for defendant. Court scheduled the preliminary hearing date with the parties. Case adjourned ot Branch 17.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Per Judge- The court will address the defendant's letter addressed to the court requesting dismissal at the next hearing on 05/31/2022.

Defendant Michael Timothy Shelton not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for a State V-LEE hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss with Prejudice.  (Michael T. Shelton, Jr. - #453917, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, PO Box 3310, Oshkosh WI 54903-3310).

Defendant Michael Timothy Shelton in court by video, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

03:53 PM Defendant Michael Timothy Shelton not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Michael Timothy Shelton in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Michael Timothy Shelton in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Timothy Shelton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  AS TO COUNT 2 "PTAC, as a Party to a Crime" enhancer:  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
